keyTakeAways: President Donald Trump commuted George Santos' federal prison sentence, releasing him from FCI Fairton, New Jersey.
George Santos pleaded guilty to fraud and identity theft, including falsely claiming financial status and stealing donors' identities.
Santos was expelled from the U.S. House of Representatives, making him one of only six members in history to be ousted by colleagues.
Trump's commutation was controversial, as Santos had lied about his education, employment, and religious background, and was criticized by some Republican colleagues.
Trump defended the commutation by comparing Santos' actions to those of Senator Richard Blumenthal, who falsely claimed a military service record.
The commutation also erased all financial penalties, restitution, and probation conditions associated with Santos' guilty plea.
The action is part of a broader pattern of Trump's use of executive clemency for former Republican politicians since returning to office in January 2025.

summaryOfNewsArticle: President Donald Trump commuted the federal prison sentence of former U.S. Representative George Santos, who had been sentenced to over seven years for fraud and identity theft, including fabricating his background and stealing donors' identities. Santos, expelled from Congress after revelations of false claims about his education, employment, and religious identity, was released from FCI Fairton, New Jersey, on October 17, 2025. The commutation, which erased all fines, restitution, and probation, drew both praise and criticism within the Republican Party, with some, like Marjorie Taylor Greene, supporting it as a matter of justice, while others, such as Nick LaLota, argued the crimes warranted greater punishment. Trump justified the decision by comparing Santos’ deception to past misstatements by Senator Richard Blumenthal, and the move reflects a broader pattern of executive clemency for former Republican politicians since Trump's return to office in January 2025.
title: Trump Commutes Prison Sentence of Former Rep. George Santos
